markdown:
Corpseroots are rotten, undead trees that grow bright-red poisonous fruit and spread blight to surrounding plants, transforming healthy trees into new corpseroots. These cunning killers drain the life from creatures through their root systems, posing as dead trees until their victims come within reach. Corpseroots most commonly form from rotten husks of trees that died from supernatural blights, making them common threats in the Fangwood and Fierani forests. The most powerful are ancient trees used as shrines and sacrificial altars, their roots absorbing the blood, flesh, and terror of those condemned under their boughs. Some of these ancient corpseroots still command the respect and devotion of the cults that inadvertently created them. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Corpseroot](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1847) **Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 81 **Perception** +18; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +24, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +18 **Str** +7 **Dex** +3 **Con** +5 **Int** -2 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +2 **Plant** When it isn't in danger, the corpseroot spends 1 minute rooting to the earth, becoming planted in place. While the corpseroot is planted and immobile, creatures must actively [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) and succeed at a DC 36 Perception check (DC 40 in forests) to detect the corpseroot's true nature. --- **AC** 30 **Fort** +24 **Ref** +18 **Will** +18 **HP** 225 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** bludgeoning 10, piercing 10 **Weaknesses** axe vulnerability, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 10 **Axe Vulnerability** The corpseroot takes 10 additional damage from [axes](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1).
**Blight** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) 30 feet. A [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125) entering or starting its turn in the corpseroot's aura begins to wither and must succeed at a DC 27 Fortitude save or become [sickened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (sickened 4 on a critical failure). A plant that succeeds is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
A plant that stays in the aura for 7 consecutive days must succeed at a DC 27 Fortitude save or die. If the plant was a creature or tree, it rises as a corpseroot. The newly risen corpseroot can't create more corpseroots but has all other corpseroot abilities. Plants that are neither [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) nor creatures automatically fail saves against blight. --- **Speed** 20 feet **Melee** branch +24 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+10 bludgeoning **Melee** root +24 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 3d8+10 bludgeoning plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Ranged** rotten fruit +20 ([range increment 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150)), **Damage** 3d4+7 bludgeoning plus 2d6 poison [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150) damage **Take Root** ([Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** The corpseroot has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33); **Effect** The corpseroot buries its roots into the creature, dealing 1d6+11 piercing damage and draining the target's life force (DC 30 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). On a failure, the creature is [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) (or increases the value by 1 if already drained), and the corpseroot regains 10 HP. If this would make a creature drained 5, the creature dies.
Fearsome Foes Although they lack the intelligence of most humanoids, corpseroots are cunning and understand the languages of their two most hated foes, [arboreals](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=8) and [fey](/Traits.aspx?ID=69), both of whom strike against corpseroots upon discovering them. Most corpseroots strive to avoid the notice of these enemies by blending in among other dead plants and remaining immobile whenever arboreal or fey hunters pass by.
